macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: U.S. Stocks Close Higher on Friday After Jobs Report
items.summary: U.S. equities ended the trading week on a positive note with all three major benchmarks recording gains. The S&P 500 added 44.82 points (0.65%), the Dow Jones rose 237.96 points (0.48%), and the Nasdaq Composite increased 191.33 points (0.81%).

items.title: Trump Administration Directs Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to Purchase $200 Billion in Mortgage-Backed Securities
items.summary: The Trump administration directed mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to purchase $200 billion in mortgage-backed securities aimed at lowering borrowing costs.

items.title: Intel Surges 10.8% Following Presidential Meeting
items.summary: Intel stock surged 10.8% following reports of a productive meeting between the U.S. president and Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan.

items.title: Sector Performance: Materials and Utilities Lead Gains
items.summary: Nine of the 11 primary S&P 500 sectors ended positive, with materials rising 1.8% and utilities up 1.24%, while healthcare and financial sectors lagged with declines of 0.58% and 0.35% respectively.

items.title: Supreme Court to Rule on Reciprocal Tariffs on January 14
items.summary: Market participants are awaiting a Supreme Court ruling on the legality of reciprocal tariffs, which has been rescheduled for January 14.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Morgan Stanley files with SEC for spot Bitcoin and Solana ETFs
items.summary: Morgan Stanley has filed with the U.S. SEC to launch exchange‑traded funds tied to **bitcoin** and **solana** prices, marking one of the most significant moves by a major U.S. bank into regulated crypto exposure and signaling growing institutional comfort with ETF-based crypto access.

items.title: Truebit’s TRU token crashes 99.9% after exploit drains 8,535 ETH
items.summary: The Truebit (TRU) token plunged about **99.9%** after an exploit of an older smart contract reportedly allowed an attacker to extract **8,535 ETH** (around $26.6 million), reigniting concerns over legacy contract risks and security practices in DeFi projects.

items.title: U.S. Senate crypto market structure bill talks intensify ahead of Jan. 15 markup
items.summary: Senators continue negotiations on a major **crypto market structure** bill with a markup planned for Jan. 15, including proposed language on how exchanges can pay rewards on **dollar‑pegged stablecoin** transactions while restricting rewards on idle tokens, highlighting ongoing efforts to define U.S. crypto and stablecoin rules.

items.title: Wyoming announces first state‑backed blockchain stablecoin
items.summary: Wyoming has issued what it calls the first **state‑backed stablecoin**, described as the first blockchain‑based asset backed directly by a U.S. state, underscoring growing experimentation by state governments with on‑chain financial instruments.

items.title: World Liberty Financial seeks OCC national trust bank charter to issue USD1 stablecoin
items.summary: World Liberty Financial, a crypto firm linked to the Trump family, has applied for an **OCC national trust bank charter** to support issuance and conversion of its **USD1 stablecoin**, aiming to operate under a federal banking framework while expanding stablecoin-based services.

items.title: Early‑2026 rotation sees altcoins and small caps outperform as Bitcoin sentiment stays cautiously bullish
items.summary: Despite continued **bullish long‑term predictions for Bitcoin**, market rotation in early 2026 has favored smaller‑cap projects and certain altcoins, reflecting a shift in risk appetite even as overall sentiment remains cautious amid macro uncertainty.

items.title: Altcoins XPR Network, LOAN Protocol, XRP, Metal Blockchain, and Metal DAO lead weekly gains
items.summary: On a 7‑day basis, **XPR Network (XPR)** rose 23.2%, **LOAN Protocol (LOAN)** 21.9%, **XRP** 9.0%, **Metal Blockchain (METAL)** 8.6%, and **Metal DAO (MTL)** 8.5%, as smaller‑cap and selected altcoins showed relative strength while the broader market remained in ‘Fear’ territory on the Crypto Fear & Greed Index.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: DeepSeek Introduces Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections for Transformer Stability
items.summary: DeepSeek proposes a core transformer architecture change called Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections (mHC) that stabilizes multi-lane residual networks, reducing worst-case gradient amplification from around 3000 to 1.6.

items.title: Falcon-H1R: 7B Model Achieves Performance of Models 7x Larger
items.summary: Falcon-H1R, a 7-billion parameter model optimized for reasoning tasks, rivals models up to 7 times larger in benchmark performance through efficient training and improved Chain-of-Thought capabilities.

items.title: MIT and Microsoft Develop CleaveNet for AI-Generated Cancer Detection
items.summary: Researchers at MIT and Microsoft built CleaveNet, an AI system that designs protein sequences to detect hidden signs of disease by turning enzyme activity into measurable signals, improving precision medicine.

items.title: Boston Dynamics Trains Humanoid Robot to Learn Factory Tasks from Video
items.summary: Boston Dynamics' AI-powered humanoid robot learns factory tasks by watching humans, processing video and sensor data to map actions into reusable skills that can be recombined for new tasks.

items.title: Sandia Labs Develops Neuromorphic Algorithm for Energy-Efficient Supercomputing
items.summary: Scientists at Sandia National Laboratories created an algorithm enabling neuromorphic hardware to solve complex fluid dynamics equations using brain-like spiking-neuron patterns, consuming far less energy than traditional supercomputers.

items.title: AI Development Accelerating with New Moore's Law: Doubling Every 4 Months
items.summary: Recent analysis shows AI capabilities are doubling every 4 months rather than the traditional 2-year cycle, with industry structure shifting toward smaller, flatter teams optimized for speed.

items.title: CES 2026: AI Embedded Across All Device Categories
items.summary: At CES 2026, AI was showcased as background technology optimizing devices and learning user behavior rather than standalone tools, with major advances in mobility, entertainment, and smart infrastructure.

items.title: OpenAI Expands into Healthcare with AI Prescription Refill Services
items.summary: OpenAI is entering the healthcare vertical with AI prescription refill capabilities and FDA-approved AI devices, marking a significant expansion beyond education and shopping.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
